website_summaries.verdict: Frontline Plus targets flea infestations specifically, ideal for sensitive dogs that test negative for heartworm.
pros: Uses 2 medications to kill adult fleas and their eggs
Topical formula is easy to apply, lasts for 30 days
Does not aggravate existing skin conditions
cons: Can take more than 72 hours to start working
Does not kill fleas at all cycles of life

customer_reviews.title: Totally ineffective!!!
customer_reviews.text: I shaved my dogs hair on his back to the closest setting on Saturday, 10/14. I attempted to shave & trim other more sensitive areas as he would allow & tolerate & as close as possible as his skin is irritated by the fleas. I applied directly to skin all along my dogs back, starting between the shoulder blades all the way to his tail. By Wednesday, 10/18, he still has a lot of fleas (see attached pic of his belly). Extremely dissatisfied with the failure and total lack of effectiveness. Horrible product & will be looking into how I can get my money back!!!
customer_reviews.author: A. Moore

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this product 0 stars I would. It doesn't deserve the one star. I applied this to my chihuahua assuming it was real frontline, like the kind I get from my vet and she was infested with fleas and ticks a week later from spending time in our backyard. We have never had a flea problem in the 7 years I've had this dog. I am disgusted. I have a baby and now we have to deal with fleas in our house and trying to get rid of them without harmful chemicals so as not to expose dangerous chemicals to the baby. Don't buy! Go to the vet. Don't make the same mistake I did.
customer_reviews.author: Sweet Shopper

customer_reviews.title: I have had good luck with the product until I bought it here ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using frontline for years. I normally buy it at the pet store. I have had good luck with the product until I bought it here from the seller on Amazon. I do not think it's the real thing because it has not worked at all!!!!!!! It does not even smell like the usual frontline I buy at the pet store!! Do not waste your money on this product I tried it twice and it has not worked either time. I thought maybe the first time I just got a bad batch. Now I'm going to the pet store to buy more what a waste of money this product is!!!!! Beware!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: SacsSecret

customer_reviews.title: Product does not work.
customer_reviews.text: As I'm reading the the reviews now I'm seeing the reviews I see that apparently they are switching out the product from the picture for a different one. I do not have the box anymore so I cannot check if this is what happened with mine. But I will tell you this product did absolutely nothing. My dog got horrible fleas on it and when I took her to the vet they told me to use capstar (over the counter) and combo gaurd (perscription) and her fleas were gone in a few days. But I'm mad I tried to save money on frontline when it is completely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Kandy

customer_reviews.title: After less than 24 hours I am very concerned. ...
customer_reviews.text: After less than 24 hours I am very concerned. I applied this to my chihuahua/min pincher and she has gone crazy with scratching and biting. The only reason I bought and used this is because I have to board her in 2 weeks and the office requires her to be on it (she doesn't /hasn't ever had fleas). For the last 14 hours she has non-stopped itching & biting - manically. She sleeps with us and neither of us could sleep because she was shaking the whole bed all night & miserable - if we touched her it seemed to set off another itching attack. I'm planning on calling my vets office this morning and can update this later.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great for indoor dogs
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product on both my dogs religiously month after month for several years. I came to Yosemite National Park and my little dog got bit by to line text. He became very sick and now is taking medicine I thought this was supposed to help I'll never buy it again I'm going to the vet and taking their advice.
customer_reviews.author: twyla

customer_reviews.title: I noticed the fleas were not getting better so I started researching fake Frontline
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 packages a month ago and used one application on my small dog. I noticed the fleas were not getting better so I started researching fake Frontline. My packages did NOT have an EPA regulation number anywhere on the package or on the applicator. This item is a fake and a waste of money. The EPA number must be on the item.  I will not buy this item again and am very upset. I want to know what I put on my dog and is it poisoning him?
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. They've definitely changed something in the formula - ...
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. They've definitely changed something in the formula - in years past it worked great, but when I found fleas on my dog post application I began to question its effectiveness. I waited 14 days and then applied more Frontline (it says you can do that in cases of bad infestation) and it did absolutely nothing to abate the fleas. My poor pup had to suffer for a month plus while I tried the Frontline before I could get him the K9 brand and upon application it worked IMMEDIATELY.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Totally Ineffective
customer_reviews.text: Does not work at all, at least on my dog and/or in my area. I apply it carefully and as according to the directions. I make sure it dries etc... as soon as we go outside, it's over... she's crawling with fleas again. I ended up getting a Rx from the vet for Nexgard (the chewable treat style medicine for fleas and ticks) which works REALLY well. Keep your dog safe and ditch the cheap flea and tick control. Pay a little more and get a Rx from the vet.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Buy from this seller if you want to potentially poison your dog
customer_reviews.text: Fraudulent bait-and-switch of Frontline product. Item received is nothing like that which is described. What I received is from/manufactured in Africa. Note listed specifications for Zimbabwe, Zambia, Namibia, and S. Africa on box in attached picture. Based on poisoning concerns, I will never give these to my dogs. The seller was "Paymatez".
customer_reviews.author: VV

customer_reviews.title: Ticks for days... Does NOT work!!
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this stuff worked well. I read the reviews and went with this one for my little dog, Max (weighing less than 10lbs). Bathed him, applied the treatment (4/25/2019). Last night he got another bath (he gets stinky pretty quickly). I found a living tick on his hind leg. Removed it properly and killed it. Thought "No big deal, 1 tick, OK." Well just now I FOUND ANOTHER TICK!!! WTF!?!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Never again
customer_reviews.text: My dog which is a chihuahua had a terrible neurological reaction to this product, it was like he was hallucinating on and off for 2 days. I took him to the vet and they said that when you buy flea medicine off the internet you might not be getting what you think you are and the only way to know if you get pure flea medicine is to get it from a vet. I will never buy this stuff again or any dog medicine from over the internet. BTW my dog is going to be ok.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would NOT  recommend
customer_reviews.text: This size was used on my 12 pound poodle with no luck ...I also have a 53 pound standard poodle. We have used 2 of the applications within a 2week span. Groomer said alot of fleas were still on her .so we had to go to the vet and purchase a pill to rid the fleas. Such a waste of my money to of tried your product on 2 dogs 2 separate size dogs to purchase.. so expensive to not work ...with 2 purchases I am upset and feel very misled..I would NOT recommend...
customer_reviews.author: The Duke's

customer_reviews.title: Same great product, very low price
customer_reviews.text: Several buyers were concerned with 2 things: 1st was whether or not the product was authentic. The product delivered by Famous Shamus Pet Supplies was genuine. EPA stamps present, no change in effectiveness. The 2nd issue seems be the product's current effectiveness, seen by some as a potential change in the Frontline formula. My understanding is that the active ingredients in this product are the same as always. What has changed are the fleas. In some areas, fleas are becoming resistant to these ingredients, and in that case you should switch to a newer, different product. So for me, same great product, lower price than my local Walmart. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Long Interval of Sanity

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me
customer_reviews.text: I keep reading reviews that say this product doesn't work. I have three small dogs. Around 10 pounds. Which may make a difference. It works fine on my dogs. I've had to use it twice this summer and no fleas. People should understand that if the flea population in your home gets bad enough, you also have to take extra measures like vacuuming every day. I never let it get to that point. The minute I see a flea I get Frontline. I prefer it to the oral treatments with smaller dogs. It seems less toxic to me.
customer_reviews.author: KLS

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Well I started him on the 1st dose as soon as I received it June 4th Second dose July 3rd due to us heading up North to go camping. Well we are home and hes full of fleas so this stuff apparently is CRAP. I'M BEYOND PISSED PAYING THIS PRICE FOR MY DOG TO BE SCRATCHING RHE CRAP OUT OF HIMSELF. I went thru and pulled 4 fleas off of him. He's a Yorkie/Shih Tzu so hair is shorter and easy to spot.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: I used it for many years and it was great but for some reason the past few years it ...
customer_reviews.text: Frontline no longer works for my animals. I used it for many years and it was great but for some reason the past few years it hasn't worked. I kept ordering thinking it was a old batch or my pet got wet to soon . I kept thinking it had to be something else. I finally gave up a few months ago. I won't be ordering again . My vet told me the company that made it has reported in 50% of the cases it isn't working. Sorry to see this because it was my flea meds of choice for 15 or 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy K Pichette

customer_reviews.title: Used On & Off, But Officially DONE
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I have been using frontline on and off for awhile. Well this last time was my final straw. My dog got hot spots so bad and SO MANY FLEAS after using frontline. Instead of helping my dog, it hurt my dog. She is a Maltipoo and her hair is long and her skin is sensitive. I had to shave her all the way to the skin to help her get rid of all the fleas and damage to her body. I ended up going to the vet and they prescribed her some flea medicine called Bravecto. I plan on going this route from now on out for my dog during flea seasons. This was so horrible and devastating experience.
customer_reviews.author: Misty Heagney

customer_reviews.title: Feeling ripped off
customer_reviews.text: Sadly this did not prevent a massive flea infestation. I'm now battling a house full of fleas with three dogs and a family with three children, two of which are preemie newborn twins and an adult who is highly allergic to fleas. Never have we ever gotten fleas on our dogs. Even when our neighbors did. I switched brands this flea season and it was a HUGE mistake! I'd love to get my money back so I can put it twards the battle at flea house!! I've had to throw away all our area rugs and dog beds. Buying this cost me money. Seriously disappointed customers
customer_reviews.author: Tailynn Safford

customer_reviews.title: Authentic Merial Frontline at Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Made sure this was the real deal before applying to my dog. Bought the option "Shipped From and Sold by Amazon." I checked the lot code on the outside of the box matched the lot code on each vial package. I also made sure the vial said "Merial" on it. Everything checked out and I applied to my dog - so far no fleas :) Cheaper than the vet office and other online vendors.
customer_reviews.author: Karyn

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: I've used frontline purchased from a vet in the past and it seemed to work fine. I'm not sure if this is a different solution/strength than what is available from your vet, but this product absolutely did not work. Directions on the package say it will completely break the flea life cycle if applied monthly. I've applied this on my dog for four months...each month it seems to work initially for a week or so, but after a couple of weeks they reappear just as strong. I'm going to try a different product with better reviews.
customer_reviews.author: T. Eagling

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I've been applying this on my 14 lbs dog every month since Feb. First.. I thought it worked.. but I don't know what happened. I found some flea bites on my dog. I noticed him feeling uncomfortable so I decided to comb through his fur. This breaks my heart! I will not buy this anymore. I need to find another brand that will work. I have been so diligent with the applications and putting reminders on my calendar. This stuff obviously doesn't work. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing technically “negative” to say. It’s easy to use. Goes on as a clear liquid. Doesn’t seems to bother my dog. Although, I wish one dose lasted longer than a month. Some brands for one dose lasts 3 months. Just a bit annoying to reapply every month.
customer_reviews.author: Chieko

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective on my Dog
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased this product from my vet in the past and it was outstanding! However, this is the 3rd dosage and it appears to have no effect at this point. I don't know if this product has been exposed to heat or other elements that might have effected the potency, so I will be purchasing this product from my vet locally in the future as I know they purchase directly from the distributor. I am very disappointed and feel I've wasted 100% of my money on this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: still have fleas
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 dogs and 2 cats. we only use the Frontline for our small dog. 2 months in a row she still has fleas. just did again and 4 days later fleas all over her, well not around her neck. but all over the back part of her. All the other pets flea free no problem. Will not be using Frontline again. Had this same problem with the walmart brand a few years ago. Doesn't work all over, just where you put it on back of neck. JUNK!
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: This does not work!!!
customer_reviews.text: Applied in the spring as a precautionary before flea season with no fleas in sight but by the time he needed his second dose he had fleas, I was thinking it was because i was 2 days late giving him his 2nd treatment. It's been a week since his 2nd treatment and he still has fleas!!!! This is horrible!!! I think the other reviews are right in saying this is a fake product wrapped in a name brand box. What a crock!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mamabird4

customer_reviews.title: May cause pain and twitching to your pet for days!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We have used frontline advantage for years with no problems, however we got the frontline plus this time and it really hurt our Chihuahua, it burned the back of her neck and she has been twitching and crying for the last 4 days and it seems there is nothing we can do about it. I intend to pursue this on a more legal basis if we incur any vet bills due to this "new and improved" crap Be very careful and test your dog first if you buy this product.........You have been warned.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey Penley

customer_reviews.title: Was good at first, then not at all.
customer_reviews.text: This product worked well (or so we thought) for the first couple of months. We've been diligent about treating our (very clean) home, vacuuming regularly, applying this product as directed etc. We give our 16lb mix breed regular flea baths, again, as directed when using this product. However, the fleas have slowly been getting worse. I have contacted the manufacturer directly and provided them with pictures of the product box, lot number and UPC. They are investigating, and will get back to me. In the meantime, I've cancelled our auto-ship subscription here.
customer_reviews.author: canadianlilyberry

customer_reviews.title: I also purchase this for our cat and the cats is working fine no issues
customer_reviews.text: This was awful, we have used Frontline plus for years and never had any issues with fleas, at first I thought maybe my son had given our dog a bath to soon after applying the first application, so I applied a second one, nothing happened except my doggie continued to get more fleas, we waited a week and applied the 3rd one, again still more fleas. I also purchase this for our cat and the cats is working fine no issues. I think the one I got for dogs isn't the real stuff, it seems that fake frontline is being marketed as the real stuff. very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: darlene

customer_reviews.title: Fake product?
customer_reviews.text: My poor dog is infested with fleas. I have been using this product according to the directions. Like other people, I am wondering if this is a fake product. I trust this brand, having used it for years, but I will not be ordering it from Amazon again. I went to my vet for flea meds yesterday for my cats and dogs. The cats are already better. The dog may take more time. I feel so bad.
customer_reviews.author: Miss D

customer_reviews.title: Horrible experience with this product!!
customer_reviews.text: Second time ordering this product for my dog day after application while petting my dog I felt bumps in the area I applied medication . Evaluated area next day to see my poor baby full on skin Soares . Will never order this product again. Hopefully medicated shampoo will help.. or else vet awaits.. so disappointed with product. Scary!! Will never recommend this product.. instead will advise all friends and family to stay away from it!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still has fleas
customer_reviews.text: I administered the first treatment of this product to my 20lb dog and 2 weeks later, still had fleas. At 2 weeks, put on the second treatment at 2 weeks, a week later my dog STILL has lots of fleas. As this is supposed to be a monthly treatment, probably not a good idea to administer all 3 treatments in 3 weeks, so is there something I am missing or am I correct in that this expensive flea treatment is worthless???? Not happy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Quarton

customer_reviews.title: Want a refund
customer_reviews.text: Got it on Sept 11, put it on my dog September 12, and October 10th. Noticed him scratching alot on October 19th. I gave him a bath and he had about 10 fleas on him! It's now time for his 3rd dose which is all he would have needed because it's freezing at night. Now I have to get another package to ensure fleas are gone. This product is not cheap and the refund window should not be 30 days if the product doesn't work
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: I Had To Apologize To My Dog...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for my dog for years. Look folks, don't go for the cheaper stuff. This works and my dog is flea-free. I used some other product and the fleas jumped on my poor baby. Well, that just upset me to see her itching. I applied this and by the next morning, she was no longer scratching. I apologized to my dog and put myself in timeout. I'll never stray from Frontline again.
customer_reviews.author: ICULookN

customer_reviews.title: not working so good this year
customer_reviews.text: In the past, this product has worked for me. This year, I continue to find fleas on my dog. Maybe my yard is infested, & everytime she goes outside she picks up 2 or 3 fleas. I have not gotten them in my house yet, so maybe they are dying before they can reproduce....not working so good this year. I went to the vet & got a Comfortis pill for the month of July.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fake Product- Scam
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy- THIS IS FAKE! I’ve always used Frontline & figures I could purchase it without having to go to Petco since we are in the Shelter in place , due to the Pandemic. It was a mistake! These drops are not the real frontline. It’s a scam. These will not fight off fleas, ticks, anything, worst purchase I’ve made. Can’t believe Amazon allows them to sell this crap. Save your money & go buy the real deal!
customer_reviews.author: missbaybeeluv

customer_reviews.title: Great value, but cant subscribe to 2 different sizes.
customer_reviews.text: Have always used Frontline, and its a great value when you subscribe to get it delivered every 3 months, so you dont forget. Only problem is you can only subscribe to one. I have 2 dogs, one is large and the other is a small breed. So now i have to remember to order for one of them as you cant have auto delivery on 2. Only reason I gave 4 stars as inconvenient to order.
customer_reviews.author: D. Pelikan

customer_reviews.title: My dog had a ton of flees this summer and ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog had a ton of flees this summer and in Los Angeles we even had flees this year in November because of the warm weather. It takes about 8-10 hours for it kills the flees if they are stubborn and refuse to flee! I literally saw one crawl off my dog and die. My dog is under 7 lbs and he had no side effects for this. I also place a small amount at the base of my dog's tail since it did not always seem to get the ones on his behind.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Zapata

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this here.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product in the past purchased from my vet but this is absolutely worthless and nothing like that purchase. I checked my dogs who only go out to potty after one week since application and they were infested with fleas. It did absolutely nothing. If anything, the fleas are worse since I trusted it to take care of them.
customer_reviews.author: Regina Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Not working to kill fleas this year -- worked in previous years
customer_reviews.text: We had been using this Frontline product on our dog every summer with success. BUT it did not work this spring -- the fleas stayed alive & moved into biting us & the kids. Not good! Vet recommended a pill treatment for fleas instead.
customer_reviews.author: Jen PR

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!! FAKE PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: THIS PRODUCT IS A FAKE!! It did not protect my poor babies from ticks. I am extremely pissed just finding this out. And what did I put on my dogs?? It doesn’t even smell like the NORMAL LEGIT Frontline. I will never again try to save a buck and get it from anywhere else but a store.
customer_reviews.author: 🌸Nicole Amber🌸

customer_reviews.title: Don't recommend, doesn't work anymore- fleas developing resistance
customer_reviews.text: I live in a moderate climate (DC) where much of the year is warm to hot and humid- so good breeding ground for fleas. Although I live in a city where you wouldn't worry about fleas as much (I guess, except that rats carry them?). Anyway... my dog got several fleas while using this product. And our vet and the pet store said that fleas are becoming resistant to this product. Not sure if it's just local fleas or broadly. But unfortunately I have to say "DO NOT RECOMMEND" because it doesn't work. The fleas I found on my dog were alive, too.
customer_reviews.author: Erika N Huber

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed with this I bought it April 28th and got it a few days later I noticed my dog has fleas all over her so I gave her a second treatment earlier than what it says to do and two days later she is still covered in fleas. I thought it would be more convenient just to order it but I think there is something was wrong with this product you are selling
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: FAKE FRONTLINE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I could not figure out why our poor dog has continued to itch even after a 1 month application of this Frontline...because it's FAKE!!! This product that I received was made in France, not the USA!! Poor Moe!! Beware do not buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Legare

customer_reviews.title: I wish it still worked.
customer_reviews.text: Frontline has always worked well in the past, but this last dose did not even work for two weeks. I paid over $200 to have my two dogs be seen by a vet in order to get a stronger, internal-dose protection. The vet said she has a feeling that the fleas in the area where we are visiting have become immune to Frontline, so I will no longer be able to use it. However, it may still work well for your dogs in other areas.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: Frontline should let the buyer know that this does not work in Florida. My dogs fleas increased 10 X in 3 days after using. I just moved to Florida so I called a new vet for an appointment. That is when I learned it does not work. He prescribed the newer oral chew and it works perfectly. The fleas are gone. Southern buyers beware.
customer_reviews.author: NY Reader

customer_reviews.title: It worked but not sure
customer_reviews.text: First time I purchase this product on amazon. Price was very good so I tried. Product itself was.... not sure. I think what I received was very old.. inside silver package was very easy to remove as because it was old then, plastic to snap and open part was not snapped I had to use scissors. Last part, smells different.. we had to leave for mountain trip so I use it and my dog didn’t get any bug bite so, it worked.. I already purchased another package from other company.
customer_reviews.author: kikapics

customer_reviews.title: Used to work in the EU doesnt work in the US
customer_reviews.text: We used to apply Frontline in our old country (central/ eastern Europe) so it came natural to keep using this brand when we moved to Florida. Sadly it doesnt work in this area, maybe there are different species of flea or we some other reason, but our vet recommended a different brand that works for them, so we gotta move on.
customer_reviews.author: Janos Jaksa

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective for Ticks
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my dog 2 weeks ago. It seems to be keeping the fleas at bay for now, but it is completely ineffective for ticks. I pulled 6 off my dog last night. 6! I should have taken him to the vet to get Bravecto but I used Frontline because of the current Pandemic and used it many years ago with success. Not the same as it used to be. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: TickTockAliceTop Contributor: Eye Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product in the past and I have no complaints. Granted, my dog is mostly in the house and on walks with me. He's not running through forests and fields of high grass. Still, (fingers crossed), he hasn't had flea or tick issues. The packaging is well-executed and relatively streamlined- not a lot of waste. There's a tab on the box so that you can secure the flap 'til next time. The process of applying the solution is straightforward and simple. Yeah, it leaves a bit of an oily residue, but that goes away in about a day. Just make sure you apply it between the shoulder blades where your dog can't get to it.
customer_reviews.author: warbler

customer_reviews.title: Completely ineffective
customer_reviews.text: My dog received two months worth of doses and this didn't work AT ALL. Two different veterinarians have since told us that Frontline has been ineffective for the last couple years because fleas have become immune to this formula. It used to be great for killing fleas but now they're completely resistant. Using this treatment actually delayed us being able to use a prescription chewable tablet treatment and my dog ended up suffering for longer as a result. We really regret using this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: does not work.
customer_reviews.text: After a trip to a new dog park left my furries with fleas I tried this. First application didnt work. Instructions actually SAY you may need a 2nd dose after a couple weeks in same cases so I wasnt TOO worried. 2nd application goes on no change. Stupidly bought it a 3rd time and still no change. To my vet we go next. My thinking is that the product is expired...
customer_reviews.author: Erinmarie Christian

customer_reviews.title: This product does not work
customer_reviews.text: I have used front line for years and never found a flea on my dog. I noted other posters saying this product does not work some going back to 2018. I also found it doesn't work and found a flea on my Tinkerbell which has never happened. Amazon please consider discontinuing this seller
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This stuff does NOT work!!! We had used the correct product and measurements. For like 3 days I was so happy. Saw no fleas. By the 4th day. Our sweet little dog was covered in them. All alive. Covered. It was horrible. And yes we treated the furniture. Have no carpet. And a clean house. So no clue why this didnt work for our dog or our cats.
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: Missing a tube / 1 was dried out
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving it a 1 star because out of the the 3 tubes I ordered one of them was dried out so I had to use a 2nd one which it left me with one left, not to thrilled that I have to purchase a full 3 in a month ,, but this time I will go into a pet store to buy it this way I can see that all the tubes are full and I’m not cheated out of a full set , I should’ve returned it but I knew my dog needed it so I kept it ,,
customer_reviews.author: Esther

customer_reviews.title: I have spent $300 to get rid of fleas
customer_reviews.text: I live in San Diego and due to the heavy rain, we have had the worst flea infestation ever. Years ago, I used Frontline which I bought at the vets office and it was fine. Now that I bought it online, it didn't work. I have had to wash my dogs every day, take one to the vet, and bugbomb my house. I am 60 and exhausted. Next time, I will take the dogs to the vet and get a prescription. Every one else I know has done it and hasn't had a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Santa Cruz

customer_reviews.title: frontline 5-22 lb dog
customer_reviews.text: I have no problem with Amazon or TopDawg Pet Supply. My problem is with the Frontline It just isn't effective on my 20lb Lhasa Apso. My Vet says that sometimes happens, where a dog will become used to the Treatment and it fails to keep them flea free. It would only last 11⁄2 to 2 weeks before I started finding live fleas on him, quite a few. of them. I changed to Comfortis, and it lasts a full 30 days. .
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Rodriquez

customer_reviews.title: The BEST!!
customer_reviews.text: Off & on for years I’ve tried other brands of flea & tick control thinking “maybe this time”...WRONG!!! No doubt, you can’t get anything out there better than Frontline Plus! This is the real stuff people! Arrived quickly Packaged well and at a great price! Would highly recommend this product if you despise fleas as much as I do!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my shihtzu. She has skin and flea allergies. The flea allergies are only unbearable in the late summer. So I don't use this often, only as needed . First time buying online and not from a vet. Seemed like it took about a week to really take full affect. She hasn't been scratching or crying like a crazed lunatic. Her sores have healed and I don't see any fleas on her. Seems decent for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Chance Savant

customer_reviews.title: Great service amazing product
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing but good things to say about this product. First the seller shipped it out quick and it arrived when it said it would. Second this worked so good on my maltipoo she was suffering from so many fleas and I put this medicine on her within a couple of days the fleas started to fall off and she felt much better. Will be ordering from this shop again and highly recommend this frontline product.
customer_reviews.author: MrsC

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and good value
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use once you get your dog to stay still. Our trick is to wait until she is sleepy at nighttime, and my wife holds her looking out window (10 pounds) while I apply. Otherwise, she moves around too much. You apply it all in one spot between shoulders. This is easier (at least for our dog) than other brands where you apply it in a line down back. The reminder stickers are helpful for remembering when she is due for next one.
customer_reviews.author: vac

customer_reviews.title: Beware of counterfeit product; potential pesticide
customer_reviews.text: Product had severe reaction in our dog; poisoning basically. The product didn’t even kill fleas and upon looking up the lot number, there have been confirmed reports of this product being a counterfeit passed off as authentic. Please make sure the seller and product are legitimate when purchasing, there may be a good chance the official product works but make sure it’s not one of many bootlegs being sold under this name. As for our dog, one rather expensive vet visit and meds later, our dog has recovered; however, not without giving us a poisoning scare. There are many confirmed online reports of the counterfeit incapacitating and even killing dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Jany

customer_reviews.title: Frontline is at the back of the line
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying Frontline for at least 6 months, my 12 lb. dog spends most of his time inside in a controlled environment with no other pets. Frontline is applied as directed but doesnt seem to do anything for the fleas I find on him. I have to comb through his fur daily to find fleas and to help him with the fleas itching and biting. Frontline doesn't seem to do anything to detour or kill fleas. Will NOT buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Ortega

customer_reviews.title: Don’t use it!!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is 11 years old. I have always gotten her the expensive stuff from the veterinarian but this spring I decided to be cheap. Big mistake!! My dog has had to wear a cone for the last 2 months, because Frontline Plus has caused her to itch and chew herself completely raw!! :(
customer_reviews.author: Janis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 12 Lbs Toy Fox Terrier! Good for dogs w bad bellies.
customer_reviews.text: Use this on our 12Lbs Toy Fox Terrier. We used to give him the edible type of this product, but it upset his belly badly despite repelling bugs very well. Was nervous to use the topical treatment on such a small dog, but it absorbs into his skin quickly without getting on our furniture or bed (despite him having thin, brindle-like hair) & it seems to work just as well as the edible type did- especially w/ ticks, but it does not upset his stomach like the chewable type. If your dog goes outside at all, this is a must-have product to protect from insect-borne diseases & this is a good choice for dogs with touchy bellies.
customer_reviews.author: NSBTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Made in France
customer_reviews.text: Wish I read reviews more first. Dog had fleas a week after use so when I checked out reviews I looked at my box to see also made in France. I contacted amazon and they said that they would issue refund. I’ll have to try something else next time since you can’t return this product.
customer_reviews.author: kadidid19

customer_reviews.title: Getting results
customer_reviews.text: Gave our 8 week old American Bully a bath, and discovered that he had a few fleas. My order had just arrived in the afternoon, so I proceeded to follow the instructions on the label so that I could administer the Frontline product. After doing so, In about three or four days I didn’t see any more fleas on our Blue 👏🏾👏🏾👏🏾👏🏾
customer_reviews.author: James E Gordon II

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work any more at all.
customer_reviews.text: Ive used this when needed for years and last yr it worked. We arent in a big flea area the 2 boxes i ordered this year have done nothing on my 4 dogs, which are primarily indoor. I even shaved the 2 small dogs 2 big dogs are show dogs so also kept very clean. Wont be ordering again. Didnt work.
customer_reviews.author: tz

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: My dog is on it's second 30 day treatment. The fleas were killed when I applied the first treatment, but after 20 days they came back. I did the second treatment and they died off again only for them to return 5 days later. I've heard that the frontline on amazon has a different formula than buying it over the counter at a pet store and I believe it after my experience. I can't even get my money back because it's been too long but I wanted to give it time to work. Very disappointed I've spent too much money on this issue and I thought this would finally do it.
customer_reviews.author: McKenna Troi Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works the best for my pets.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a homeopath weirdo and like to avoid chemicals at all costs. However, every now and then you JUST need some flea medication for your pets. I use this on my pomeranian and cat and it always and consistently does the job at getting rid of fleas (at least it gets the pets to stop itching and living in agony). I also want to add, I find frontline plus and this one in particular, works better than any other topical flea treatment I have ever tried.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work. Buy in stores.
customer_reviews.text: Will not be ordering again. Frontline works GREAT, but this is (I think) a knock off. All it has done is irritate my dogs' skin and burn their hair where it was applied. We usually purchase our Frontline in person, but I thought this would be convenient. Never again! Now my dog has sores on his armpit and I have to get rid of fleas in my house for the first time in a decade of pet ownership.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It Does What It Says
customer_reviews.text: Within two days, 99% of the fleas were gone on both of my Yorkies. I am raising some stray cats so there are more fleas in my yard than would normally be there. I checked the dogs twice a day and picked off the live fleas which were sluggish and within 3-4 days there were hardly any fleas left, maybe one every day and I happen to find it before it bites. I will use this product again.
customer_reviews.author: LC Girl

customer_reviews.title: Best Product Out There
customer_reviews.text: We've tried generic versions of the flea and tick treatment for our three chihuahuas. We live right next to the wetlands in NC, and the bugs and fleas especially are extremely active. The treatment usually lasts for about 4 weeks. I notice when I've missed the 30 day mark to re-treat them, because they begin itching from mites, etc. before they show signs of fleas. The generic brands don't seem to take care of the problem, whereas Frontline does! I would definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth W Gee III

customer_reviews.title: It's totally ineffective. Does absolutely nothing.
customer_reviews.text: It literally does nothing. I have an indoor only, small dog. We've tried this in combination with a deep cleaning and regular baths. Frontline is a total rip off. There are more than ample reviews stating the same thing all over the internet saying the same thing. This stuff is 100% useless.
customer_reviews.author: Ezra J. Croft

customer_reviews.title: works but wash off After a few days.
customer_reviews.text: I tried to cancel the order asap but it wouldn't let me so i got it anyway. In the past ive used it once a year to stop fleas but my new fur baby does react with loss of hair... so after a few days i wash it off. It does work to get rid of fleas though. but i'm trying other products as well due to my dogs sensitivity to it.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Fostered a few kittens and they had fleas. Which lead to my dog getting fleas. I purchased this right away. This is the second month of using the product and it did nothing to rid them. My dog is still scratching and I found fleas on him when I bathed him. Waste of money...
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Good flea treatment for a small dog
customer_reviews.text: We used this on my mother in law's small dog. She did not have a severe flea infestation but she was scratching a little so we put it on her to prevent worsening fleas. It worked well. She didn't mind it too much when we put it on her but she's a good dog. We recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: missing mish

customer_reviews.title: Love it, Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a show/breeder of long hair miniature Dachshunds and flea control can be very expensive. Recommendation on the box is once a month and up to every 3 months. I go with every 3 months and I have NO fleas. We're talking 7 dogs in my house. No outside kennel. I can not and will not have a flea problem. Love it, love it.
customer_reviews.author: CJS

customer_reviews.title: Used 3months straight and did nothing!
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy from this supplier. This is the first time frontline has not worked and I'm very frustrated about this because my dog has been chomping away on herself. I figured it was because its winter and dry skin so gave her a bath with the good stuff and found a few big fleas. Frontline from other suppliers has always worked! I'm calling amazon to complain.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Not authentic. Not worth $10 much less $40
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of not reading the reviews before purchasing. I've never hd flea problems while using Frontline from my vet. I purchased this 3 month supply and my dog had fleas within 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten J

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money. Seriously.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work. We moved to the country and have plenty of ticks out here. The whole tome we used this, our dogs continued to get tons of ticks. Coincidentally they haven’t even gotten more than 1 tick here and there since we stopped using it.. and we’ve done nothing to treat the ticks so.....
customer_reviews.author: Angelica Phillips

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY. VERY DANGEROUS.
customer_reviews.text: This product made both my dogs sick. One got a slight burn and had ear twitches commonly known to happen when dogs have medicine poisoning. He eventually just fell over 20 minutes after application. My other dog, who is much heavier had extremely heavy panting. I thought he was going to pass out. I washed both my boys immediately after realizing they were ill. DONT BUY THIS!! Amazon doesn’t offer refunds either! PLEASE DO NOT BUY THIS FOR YOU FURRY BABIES. IT IS DANGEROUS.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Not controlling fleas
customer_reviews.text: Fleas in my area seem to be immune to Fipronil and (S)Methoprene. I am switching to a product with Imidacloprid, Permethrin, and Pyriproxifen (Nylar).
customer_reviews.author: Example: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Useless!
customer_reviews.text: I apllied as directed to my dogs shoulder blades. 4 days later she was still covered in fleas. She is only 10lbs, so this had plenty of time to work.... This is the 3rd brand of topical I've tried in a month. All useless against the fleas in San Diego...
customer_reviews.author: nlm

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t like that it’s only a one month supply. This works like a charm. I have two pups, I mostly keep them indoors , but it didn’t take much for them to get fleas! Smh. I purchased an expensive flea bath but realized once I bathe them and apply the frontline, they were good. Any fleas around also died.
customer_reviews.author: Sweetchelly

customer_reviews.title: A Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: After the first 3 months, our 3 dogs were still bothered by fleas. We bought another 3 months but used only one realizing Frontline Plus did not do what it was supposed to do. Two 3-months orders cost us $175. We had sprayed the carpet, the grass, their beds, washed bedding, set up Foggers, and did much more. Still, our dogs couldn't stop scratching. We even got flea bites. We tossed the reminder of Frontline Plus and bought a one-time chew (good for 3 months) from our Vets. Within 24 hours, our dogs stopped scratching. We'll never buy Frontline Plus again.
customer_reviews.author: Jannine Corti Petska

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it it dosen't work at all thieves is all they are.
customer_reviews.text: this is a complete waste of money, I put it on my dog and she kept scratching so I gave her a bath a week after thinking maybe the frontline was irritating her but no she had at least fifty fleas on her I have been ripped off by these people and amazon that's it for my prime membership amazon and frontline are rip offs.
customer_reviews.author: lenspool

customer_reviews.title: FRONTLINE PLUS----------do not buy
customer_reviews.text: put on my dog on the tenth and a she gets flea meds every month !!!!! Just ran a flea comb through her hair because shes itching all the time and there were 6 fleas on the flea comb ran the comb through again and more flea : ( needless to say Ive been vacuuming and she'd just had a bath the night before I'm soooo freaked because there were so many and I know theres still more
customer_reviews.author: kay

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work at all
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't pleased with this at all expected alot more from brand and for price I paid. My dog barely had fleas and used this procudt as instructed and nothing happened she still had issues with fleas and dried her skin and fur out horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Nope and nope.
customer_reviews.text: Zero stars if I could. Does not work at all. Fleas everywhere on them and inside my home... plus my dogs are miserable. Had used this for years but it simply does not work anymore. Vet advises not to use any other product until the month is over to avoid risk of overdose. I'll have 3 miserable pups and a miserable cat for several weeks. Go to your vet and use something g different.
customer_reviews.author: Susanne

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good product best of all my dogs do not swallow the insecticide like other products. Ive been using this for 15 years on my dogs and they never had ticks or fleas! I recommend !
customer_reviews.author: Christy V

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work.  Dogs still scratching
customer_reviews.text: This does not work. I have 2 pomeranians . I applied flea treatment last week to both of them. They are still scratching away like crazy. They both weigh about 8 lbs so dosage isnt the issue. I would like r return and get a efund . I noticed no returns.
customer_reviews.author: fitnessgeek

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy, counterfeit!
customer_reviews.text: I echo the many other reviews that say do not buy. This product is completely ineffective and likely counterfeit. Pay attention to the seller and country of origin. This is not real Frontline. My dog never had fleas before using this!
customer_reviews.author: scott davis

customer_reviews.title: Great  Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I use Frontline during the Spring/Summer months on my dog.. I have never had any problems with fleas and this works very well. It is easy to use. You put the frontline between the shoulder blades and it is good for one month. I have tried other flea remedies but Frontline seems to work the best with less mess.
customer_reviews.author: KSK

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for us.
customer_reviews.text: We couldn’t find any expiration date on the boxes we received. We’ve used Frontline for years on large and small dogs, these did not work.
customer_reviews.author: RGR

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: I paid $35.00for this product used it 2 months in@ row on my Chihuahua it has not killed a single flea in fact she has more. I was told this was the safest to use for a pregnant dog even my vet recommended it I usually use advantage. I'm totally disappointed and 35.00 in the hole. I will never use this product. Again.
customer_reviews.author: Celeste crosby

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty sure this doesn't work. I've used it properly, per the instructions, 2 packets in 45 days bc my 7 month old puppy keeps scratching and doing that frantic biting thing they do when a flea initially bites. No money back, either since it takes longer than a mere 30 days to figure out if this is going to work.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work
customer_reviews.text: I tried to give this medication some time to work itself before even writing a review. I gave it a whole three weeks! I bathed my dog before putting the ointment on, then continued to use a flea comb on her twice daily. Cleaned entire place CLEAN daily ... and still couldn't get rid of the fleas.
customer_reviews.author: Marevie

customer_reviews.title: This is the best flea medication that is out in the market
customer_reviews.text: This is the best flea medication that is out in the market. I have been using this med. for years and it has controlled the nasty flea critters that have been attacking my dog. The stores sells a pack for $68.00, where on Amazon it is a lot cheaper. I recommend this flea medication to all of our lovely dog families!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Fried

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Knockoff
customer_reviews.text: Yet another product on Amazon that appears to have a great price point, but does not work and ends up being a waste of money. Made in France huh? Maybe it works on French fleas then because this has us exactly no impact. Knockoff product, avoid and buy the real thing at a pet store.
customer_reviews.author: Spartacus

product_meta.title: Frontline Plus Flea and Tick Treatment for Small Dogs (5-22 Pounds)
product_meta.description: Size:3 DosesFRONTLINE Plus for Dogs has been trusted by veterinarians for flea and tick control for dogs for nearly 20 years. Made with 2 tough killing ingredients, fipronil and (S)-methoprene – one to kill adult fleas and ticks and the second to kill flea eggs and larvae – this fast-acting, long-lasting protection provides flea and tick control for dogs and puppies 8 weeks and older, 5-22 lbs. Its long-lasting formula is stored in the oil glands of the pet’s skin to give non-stop flea and tick protection for a full 30 days.
feature_bullets: Waterproof flea and tick treatment for dogs: Frontline Plus for Dogs provides waterproof, fast-acting, long-lasting flea and tick treatment and control for your dog. This product is approved for use on dogs 5-22 lbs.

Break the flea life cycle with frontline: Frontline flea and tick treatment for dogs kills adult fleas plus flea eggs and larvae to stop existing infestations and prevent establishment of new infestations.
Kills fleas and ticks: Frontline flea and tick treatment for dogs kills fleas, flea eggs, lice, and ticks. This flea and tick treatment kills ticks, including those that may transmit Lyme disease.

Trusted flea and tick protection for dogs: Frontline has been trusted by veterinarians for nearly 20 years. Made with 2 tough killing ingredients, fipronil and (S)-methoprene – one to kill adult fleas and ticks and the second to kill flea eggs and larvae – this fast-acting, long-lasting protection provides flea and tick control for dogs and puppies 8 weeks and older

Lasting flea and tick protection: Frontline's long-lasting formula isstored in the oil glands of the pet’s skin to give non-stop flea and tick protection for a full 30 days. Frontline flea and tick treatment for dogs works non-stop for a full 30 days. A 3-dose supply lasts for 3 months.
Customer care: If you are not satisfied with Frontline Plus for any reason, please contact the Boehringer-Ingelheim Animal Health Customer care Team at: 1-800-660-1842.
If you are not satisfied with Frontline Plus for any reason, please contact the Boehringer-Ingelheim Animal Health Customer Care Team at: 1-800-660-1842.
